summary: I’m so sorry for the actors and all the people (not D&D) who worked on this “one of the almost greatest shows of all time” that...
body: I’m so sorry for the actors and all the people (not D&D) who worked on this “one of the almost greatest shows of all time” that burned itself with the KL to the ground in the finale. Because this is how it will be remembered. And this is utterly sad!

summary: HI CLOWNS ! Due to our clowing, we decided to do a Braime Zine. A Fanzine is a zine with fanarts, fanfictions and whatever you...
caption:
HI CLOWNS !

Due to our clowing, we decided to do a Braime Zine.

A Fanzine is a zine with fanarts, fanfictions and whatever you want about  fandom or a ship in particular !

Here it’s about the pairing between Brienne of Tarth and Jaime Lannister !

The Apps will be open tomorrow until June 30th.

It’s all for free and for fun, thus if you are participate you wouldn’t be paid or you wouldn’t have to pay to have the zine !

Can’t wait to do it clowns !!

summary: You remember the times when Harry was questioning his goodness? When he firsthand saw the attack on Mr. Weasley? Actually, he...
body: You remember the times when Harry was questioning his goodness? When he firsthand saw the attack on Mr. Weasley? Actually, he was the attacker. When he almost killed Malfoy? When he confessed of having violent impulses? When he questioned if he was becoming more like Voldemort? When we found out that part of Voldemort was always in Harry? Was this a foreshadowing of HP becomig new Voldemort? Or even HP going dark/mad for some time? Joining V’s gang?

blog.name: latenightsinpemberley
blog.title: “..do you always recite poetry when you drink?”
blog.description: Feminist. Bisexual. Greek. Citizen of the world in the making. Interests include world history, high fantasy, period dramas, leftist politics and supporting women's liberation from patriarchy. A bit too fixated on Latin American and Mediterranean cultures. Lover of languages. I take my coffee with an extra pinch of sarcasm and rant a lot about female characters.

blog.name: incorrect-got
blog.title: Incorrect Game of Thrones Quotes
blog.description: Submissions are open! If you know the origin of a quote that’s tagged “Source: Unknown” do feel free to tell me!

summary: Daenerys fans have no critical thinking skills. Fire & blood, I will take what is mine repeated over and over every season and...
question: Daenerys fans have no critical thinking skills. Fire & blood, I will take what is mine repeated over and over every season and they say her behavior is out of character this episode ??? she would do ANYTHING to be queen. They think because she suffered in her life that she is vindicated in doing whatever she wants. last week it was all "dany burn it to the ground fuck yeah!" now its "dany would never burn innocents" which is it my dudes ?? this boggles my mind. im fed up w/ their bullshit.
answer:
They are so busy seeing her as a power fantasy that they failed to treat her like an actual character they should analyse. It’s why they could never predict anything and why 90% of their posts were basically ‘Dany is the queen! Jon is her hubby! They’ll dracarys their enemies together!’ Same with folks in the GA who are lamenting her character turn. They were busy wearing ‘Not a queen, a Khaleesi’ shirts to stop and really think about who Daenerys is and what she has.

Thankfully this is not universal or I might pull my hair.

They were busy wearing ‘Not a queen, a Khaleesi’ shirts to stop and really think about who Daenerys is and what she has.

Thankfully this is not universal or I might pull my hair.

summary: Jon and Dany's relationship is mirroring Joffrey and Sansa. I half-expected Jon to say "I am loyal to Daenerys, my one true...
question: Jon and Dany's relationship is mirroring Joffrey and Sansa. I half-expected Jon to say "I am loyal to Daenerys, my one true love."
answer:
While the relationship is toxic and it was very creepy when Dany told him that she’ll kill anyone who knows the truth about him, it’s not really mirroring Joffrey and Sansa. Jon had a dragon, he had constant access to Daenerys, he was told over and over again that she was a problem, he still chose to serve Daenerys. Sansa wasn’t warned about Joffrey or the Lannisters, she had limited contact with Joffrey and she never had the means to level up to Joffrey and take him down. To me Jon was willfully blind. He never saw what she did to the Lannister army, she came North to help him, while she was willing to threaten people for no good reason, he had no indication that she could destroy a city unlike us the viewers. So to him all he had to do was bear it until Dany took the throne. I don’t know why he wanted to spend the rest of his life talking Dany down from killing people.

Again the relationship is toxic but it’s a different kind of toxic to the abusive Joffrey-Sansa dynamic
